page.title: 08 Births and Deaths
page.content: We did our survey in the ten week period from the 17th April to the 19th June 1985.We gathered information from our local newspaper the East Fife Mail Altogether there were 86 deaths. 43 were male and 43 female.(We were surprised to find both sexes equal). The average age of death was 71 years. The oldest person to die was female aged 96 years.The youngest was a male aged 33 years (No cause was given). Of the 61 babies born 31 were boys and 30 were girls.Our findings show the births are not balancing with the deaths which may lead to a drop in population. We found it is the opposite in Glenrothes New Town where births outnumber deaths.This is probably because young couples are moving from Levenmouth to Glenrothes where there are more job opportunities.
